info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:56AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Putnam and Bureau Counties through 700 AM CDT... At 555 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sheffield, or 14 miles west of Princeton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Princeton, Hennepin, Spring Valley, DePue, Granville, Walnut, Ladd, Wyanet, Sheffield, Tiskilwa, La Moille, Dalzell, Buda, Bureau Junction, Mark, Ohio, Cherry, Neponset, Yorktown and Malden. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 37 and 72. Interstate 180 between mile markers 4 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for north central Illinois.
